title: Remove Posters page and stabilize frontend publish/redeploy

requirements.summary: Completely remove the Posters page by deleting its implementation, unregistering the `/posters` route, and removing all navigation links to it so the frontend builds cleanly.
acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer registers a route at `/posters` (attempting to navigate to `/posters` does not render the Posters page).
The primary site navigation no longer includes a 'Posters' link in either desktop or mobile menus.
The frontend builds successfully with no unused-import/module-not-found errors related to the removed Posters page.

file_operations.description: Remove the Posters page import and remove the `/posters` route from the TanStack Router route tree so it is no longer registered.
Remove the 'Posters' item from the navLinks array so both desktop and mobile menus no longer link to `/posters`.
Delete the Posters page implementation so it is no longer part of the frontend build.
Remove poster-related React Query hooks (e.g., fetching/uploading posters) and any related imports/types so no orphaned code or unused imports remain after removing the Posters page.

requirements.summary: Resolve the publish/republish failure by ensuring the frontend build is robust after page removal and unknown routes are handled safely in production deployments.
acceptanceCriteria: A publish/redeploy run completes successfully without showing the error message 'AI was unable to complete your request'.
The deployed application loads and routes work as expected after publishing.

file_operations.description: Add a simple Not Found screen component to render for unknown routes, preventing runtime failures when users navigate to removed paths (including the former `/posters` path).
Wire the NotFound component into the router/root route configuration as the not-found handler so navigating to removed/unknown routes does not break the app and publishing/deploying remains stable.
